name: The Parlour Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been going to Stratford for 40 years and have stayed in all kinds of places, hotels: Queen's, Mercer Hall, etc and many B&Bs. Stayed here because friends we were going with had booked here. A bit pricey, but now we are sold. Quality of sleep environment(pillows, bed & air conditioning) all excellent, room very clean, front desk staff very accomodating, all in all a first class experience. I think we have founf a new home. We could find no shortcomings.
reviews.title: Very impressed

reviews.text: Everything from the room, to the front desk people and the restaurant was great!!! Really friendly accomodating people and my room was beautiful!!
reviews.title: excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently had a little getaway in scenic Stratford, Ontario. The Parlour was an awesome choice for our accomodations. The room was spotless and spacious, very comfortable beds and chairs. We especially liked the huge bathtub. Also, accessing the Internet was very simple with the instructions provided by the front desk.
reviews.title: Can't wait for our next trip to The Parlour!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We're really looking forward to our next trip to Stratford and The Parlour!
reviews.title: Loved the Parlour

reviews.text: We stayed one night at the Parlour. The staff are very friendly and the inn is great - an old inn with lots of upgrading. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and we'll be back. We have stayed at a few other places in Stratford and this was definitely the best.
reviews.title: Very interesting atmosphere ... but poor management and customer service.

reviews.text: This was my 43rd year at Stratford. I have stayed everywhere there over the years . This was one of my best experences , if not the best... The Front desk , the room and the service was GREAT. Everyone there was wonderful... Plus Location is great. Very walkable to everything in town... My new favorate place to stay for the next few years.... rooms 304 and 315 are great...
reviews.title: The best hotel in Stratford,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Joan,Ron and Bob from Grosse Pointe. mi....
reviews.title: Stay was Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had gotten a wknd getaway as our wedding gift, and were lucky enough to use it this month..Upon check in we were greeted by a very nice, polite and friendly lady at the front desk. After checking into our room I was very impressed with the decor and the over all layout of the room. Very clean and tidy. I really liked the updated coffee maker in the room aswell. Although the weather was not so nice we were greatly impressed with the hotel and the staff and would definatly stay again to tour the Stratford area.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.text: I really hate to broadcast how terrific this hotel 'cause I'd like to be able to book here whenever I want. But they deserve it. This was the perfect stay for us. Clean, spacious, comfortable, elegant, quiet, etc. etc.
reviews.title: Great Hotel & Value for the Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel on May 2nd 2010, It is a charming hotel with lots of character. It has beautiful rooms and for the price it just can't be beat. I have stayed in hotels of this quality and paid over $200.00 but through expedia I only paid $99.00 + taxes for this one. You just can't beat this hotel for the price. I would stay here again without question.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.text: Well situated in Stratford, with theatres all within walking distance. Lovely, large rooms and kind hotel staff.
reviews.title: A Gem of a Hotel

reviews.text: We traveled to Stratford, from the Niagara region, specifically to see Christopher Plummer at the Stratford theater. Unfortunately, we got stuck in horrific traffic due to an accident (three hours of non-moving traffic). Being from the States, we had no idea what numbers to call or how to get information, so we called our hotel, although I'm not sure what we thought they could do. Shelley, the manager, was so nice and so helpful, going out of her way to find us highway information numbers, looking at maps to help us find the fastest alternate route, etc. She truly went above and beyond the call of duty, and we were so grateful!! Exceptionally friendly and nice. She made us feel like long-lost friends rather than customers. We finally made it to our performance, but we were tired by the time we got to the hotel. The rooms were neat and clean, tastefully decorated, the front desk staff very helpful, giving us a fantastic recommendation for dinner. We don't normally stay at Best Westerns in the States; we picked this place based on the TripAdvisor reviews, and we definitely didn't regret it!! Would absolutely recommend. Thanks again to all the staff and Shelley.
reviews.title: exceptionally helpful

reviews.text: My wife and I and another couple were in Stratford to see two plays. We had never stayed at The Best Western before but had dined in The Parlour restaurant. The friendliness and helpfulness of the staff from the counter and all through our stay was first rate.The location was close to shopping and to the Avon Theatre. The rooms were spotless and the beds very comfortable. As usual, the food in the restaurant was outstanding.
reviews.title: The location ,service, and food at this hotel made our trip memorable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will return again next time we're in Stratford.
reviews.title: Not as fancy as expected...

reviews.text: Previous reviews had probably just set my expectations far too high - I had a 4-star experience in mind, but it is most certainly a 3-start hotel. For that rating, it is very good, though. Excellent service with friendly staff, comfortable bed, nice in-room coffee (although it's not espresso - it's Melitta One) and very quiet. If you compare it to a motel, you get people raving about how clean it was - but that should really be a given at this price point (almost $200 for us). My critiques were: restaurant breakfast had few choices and eggs were overcooked, although building is gorgeous, guest rooms have cheesey lamps (looks like Leon's or something awful), and bedspreads and finishings that were more "Best Western" than "boutique hotel" - i.e., traditional but cheap. So those who say it is charming and unique must have spent more :), because our room was not like that (although certainly pleasant enough and comfortable). Also, it sounded so luxurious - but there are no extras (room service, robes, anything of this sort...). This may sound picky, but if you're spending almost $200, you may be better off at a B&B.
reviews.title: A jewel of a hotel with charming rooms and friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I expect at their prices to have bathrobes and a breakfast covered in the room charge. This is a clean comfortable hotel but it is no more than a 3 star. I would rather stay at the Mercer Inn where fresh fruit, cookies, real coffee and tea are provided in the room and you get breakfast as well in their restaurant. Best Western is just a chain. I will say that their staff is very pleasant.
reviews.title: Comfortable but not luxury and stingy on amenities

reviews.text: A very old inn with a lot of character. Our room (212) was spacious and well appointed with firm but comfortable beds. Bathroom has a large jet tub, upgraded fixtures. Freshly painted and decorated nicely. Lots of clean white fluffy towels. Most of all, really clean! Given the age of this building, it smelled and looked clean and fresh. Bar/restaurant downstairs has been kept original with gorgeous wood restored lovingly and reminded me of a pub I went to in Edinborough Scotland quite a few years ago. Staff were wonderful. The receptionist offered umbrellas to us as we were heading out in the rain. Breakfast of French toast on fruit was delicious and so was the coffee. There isn't a pool here, so I wouldn't recommend it for children, but it is a lovely place to stay nonetheless. Downtown shopping is a short walk up the street.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I went to Stratford for our anniversary and enjoyed every minute of our stay at the Best Western Parlour Inn & Suites. You can really see the pride of ownership throughout the property and even with the handout presented at check-in. The rooms were clean and comfortable. We ate dinner at their restuarant and enjoyed every bite. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful as well. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone that is traveling to Stratford - for business or leisure.
reviews.title: Relaxing Traditional Inn with Pride of Ownership

reviews.text: This place is greatly located in downtown stratford. We arrived early and they were comprehensive and gave us a room early to change and visit the town. THAT IS GOOD SERVICE. The rooms were clean but a bit small because it is an historic building.
reviews.title: THE BEST PLACE TO STAY IN DOWNTOWN STRATFORD

reviews.text: I generally eschew staying in chain hotels in favour of independent options, but chose the BW in Stratford out of necessity, and I must say, I was more than surprised by the entire experience. We stayed only one night, so can't comment on the amenities, but during our time there we felt very welcome, and even appreciated. The hotel was very clean, well appointed, and the service was simply exceptional at every turn. Our room was fantastic as we were given an upgrade, which of course always helps a positive review, but that wasn't even the best part; the best was how we were treated.
reviews.title: Wonderful service

aka: Best Western Plus The Parlour Historic Hotel
description: Welcome to Best Western Plus The Parlour Historic Inn & Suites!Downtown Stratford's newest boutique inn. This historic property is located in the heart of the downtown and just minutes away from Stratford's business parks, Stratford festival theatres and adjacent to the University of Waterloo Stratford Campus. Fantastic dining room and gastro-pub on site. Meeting and conference rooms available.
